amendatorysection.para: (1) Except as otherwise provided in this section, an individual who holds a resident public adjuster license or a nonresident public adjuster license shall satisfactorily complete a minimum of twenty-four credits of continuing education, including three credits of ethics, reported on a biennial basis in conjunction with the license renewal cycle.

(2) The requirements of subsection (1) of this section shall not apply to a nonresident public adjuster who has met the continuing education requirements of the adjusterâ€™s home state and whose home state gives credit to residents of this state on the same basis.
(3) Only continuing education activities approved by the director pursuant to sections 44-3901 to 44-3908 shall be used to satisfy the requirements of this section.
